images.title: Tim Heaton / Broad bridleway running west to Launde Abbey
images.caption: Broad bridleway running west to Launde Abbey. Broad bridleway running west to Launde Abbey. The bridleway from Leigh Lodge bends round to the right towards Launde Abbey (Launde Park Wood is on the far right horizon). It is joined by the Leicestershire Round; the white track snaking down the slope from the left.

description: This walk visits an Elizabethan manor house near Oakham. The historic house was built on the site of a 12th century Augustinian priory, Launde Priory. The house includes some attractive grounds with landscaped gardens and parkland containing mature trees. You can visit the abbey tea rooms and then explore the area around the delightful estate on a number of footpaths. Highlights include an 18th-century stable block, a chapel, a pretty pond, an early 19th-century ha-ha, a walled garden and a glasshouse. There's also a country lane which is suitable for cyclists. This circular walk explores the countryside surrounding the abbey, using a section of the Leicestershire Round and other public footpaths. To continue your walking in the area head east to the lovely waterside paths at Rutland Water .

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: You can continue your walking in the area by heading to the nearby Burrough Hill Country Park and Melton Country Park. There's more lovely lakeside trails with ponds, lakes and weirs to enjoy here.

display_address: Abbey Farm, Launde, Harborough, Leicestershire, England, LE7 9XB, United Kingdom
